visualization_prompt: Generate a Highcharts area chart showing intermittent data continuity using null-value connection. Requirements: single series with [1, 1, null, 1, 1], non-stacked areas, white background, blue series, styled title (bold 20px), and italic axis labels (12px black).
visualization_explanation: This area chart demonstrates null-value handling in time-series visualization. The univariate dataset contains 5 observations with 1 missing value (20% null rate). Synthetic data maintains binary states (0/1) but uses null for controlled gap testing. The area chart was chosen over line charts to emphasize magnitude continuity, with connectNulls overriding default split visualization. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through color contrast (blue series vs white background) and typographic hierarchy (bold title vs italic axis labels). Tufte's data-ink ratio is optimized by removing gridlines and non-essential chart elements. Formatting follows D3-style pattern encoding with absolute positioning (no percentage normalization).
